questions.text: A 24-year-old woman is in a car accident and is taken to an emergency room, where she receives x-ray examina ons of her neck, chest, and lower spine. It is later discovered that she is 10-weeks pregnant. Which of the following is the most appropriate statement to make to the patient?

options.label: A
options.text: The fetus has received 50 rads of x-ray exposure and will likely abort.

options.label: B
options.text: Either chorionic villus sampling (CVS) or amniocentesis is advisable to check for fetal chromosomal abnormalities.

options.label: C
options.text: At 10 weeks, the fetus is particularly susceptible to derangements of the central nervous system (CNS).

options.label: D
options.text: The fetus has received less than the assumed threshold for radiation damage.

options.label: E
options.text: The risk that this fetus will develop leukemia as a child is raised

questions.correct_answer: D. The fetus has received less than the assumed threshold for radiation damage.

questions.text: A patient presents to your office at term with no prenatal care. An ultrasound is performed and shows the fetus to be in the third trimester and to have multiple congenital anomalies, including microcephaly, cardiac anomalies, and growth retardation. You should question the patient if she has abused which of the following substances during her pregnancy?

options.label: A
options.text: Alcohol

options.label: B
options.text: Benzodiazepines

options.label: C
options.text: Heroin

options.label: D
options.text: Methadone

questions.text: Your 25-year-old patient is pregnant at 36 weeks gestation. She has an acute urinary tract infection (UTI). Of the following medications used in the treatment of UTIs, which is contraindicated in the treatment of this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Ampicillin

options.label: B
options.text: Nitrofurantoin

options.label: C
options.text: Trimethoprim/sulfamethoxazole

options.label: D
options.text: Cephalexin

options.label: E
options.text: Amoxicillin/clavulanate

questions.text: You diagnose a 21-year-old woman at 12 weeks gestation with gonorrhea cervicitis. Which of the following is the most appropriate treatment for her infection? .

options.label: A
options.text: Doxycycline

options.label: B
options.text: Chloramphenicol

options.label: C
options.text: Tetracycline

options.label: D
options.text: Minocycline

options.label: E
options.text: Ceftriaxone

questions.text: A 36-year-old G0 who has been epileptic for many years is contemplating pregnancy. She wants to stop taking her phenytoin because she is concerned about the adverse effects that the medica on may have on her unborn fetus. She has not had a seizure in the past 5 years. Which of the following is the most appropriate statement to make to the patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Babies born to epileptic mothers have an increased risk of structural anomalies even in the absence of anticonvulsant medications.

options.label: B
options.text: She should see her neurologist to change from phenytoin to valproic acid because valproic acid is not associated with fetal anomalies.

options.label: C
options.text: She should discontinue her phenytoin because it is associated with a 1% to 2% risk of spina bifida.

options.label: D
options.text: Vitamin C supplementation reduces the risk of congenital anomalies in fetuses of epileptic women taking anticonvulsants.

options.label: E
options.text: The most frequently reported congenital anomalies in fetuses of epileptic women are limb defects.

questions.correct_answer: A. Babies born to epileptic mothers have an increased risk of structural anomalies even in the absence of anticonvulsant medications.

questions.text: A 21 year old female with epilepsy is well controlled on sodium valproate 600mg bd and had been taking oral contraceptives for three years. She presented to her general practitioner with 12 weeks pregnancy.Which of the following is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: An alternative anticonvulsant should be used in place of sodium valproate

options.label: B
options.text: Interaction of sodium valproate with the oral contraceptive increased the risk of pregnancy

options.label: C
options.text: The dose of sodium valproate should be increased

options.label: D
options.text: There is an increased risk of a neural tube defect in her fetus

questions.correct_answer: D. There is an increased risk of a neural tube defect in her fetus

questions.text: A 28-year-old woman just tested positive on a pregnancy test.3 weeks ago she received a rubella vaccine and was told by her doctor to not become pregnant for the next 1 month after administration of the vaccine. Which of the following is the best advice?

options.label: A
options.text: You have the option of having a therapeutic abortion within the ?rst trimester

options.label: B
options.text: Rubella vaccine is not harmful to your fetus

options.label: C
options.text: Pregnancy outcome is usually favorable even after exposure to this vaccine

options.label: D
options.text: Live viral vaccines are associated with a fourfold increased risk of malformation

questions.correct_answer: C. Pregnancy outcome is usually favorable even after exposure to this vaccine

questions.text: A 19-year-old woman, gravida 1, para 0, presents to you at 7 weeks of gestation by her last menstrual period for prenatal care.On history she told the she has a stressful job and likes to use the hot tub at least several times a day in excess of 4 hours. What is the best advice to give to this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: You should not use hot tubs during pregnancy

options.label: B
options.text: Hot tub use in pregnancy is associated with fetal growth restriction

options.label: C
options.text: Minimize hot tub use in the first trimester because it may cause malformations

options.label: D
options.text: Hot tub use during pregnancy is acceptable as long as it is in short intervals

questions.correct_answer: C. Minimize hot tub use in the first trimester because it may cause malformations

questions.text: The increased incidence of this finding is associated with which of the following medications when used in pregnancy?

options.label: A
options.text: Valproic acid

options.label: B
options.text: Lithium

options.label: C
options.text: Fluoxetine

options.label: D
options.text: Acetaminophen

questions.text: A 37-year-old G3P2 presents to your office for her first OB visit at 10 weeks gestation. She has a history of Graves disease and has been maintained on propylthiouracil (PTU) as treatment for her hyperthyroidism. She is currently euthyroid but asks you if her condition poses any problems for the pregnancy. Which of the following statements should be included in your counseling session with the patient?

options.label: A
options.text: She may need to discontinue the use of the thionamide drug because it is commonly associated with leukopenia.

options.label: B
options.text: Infants born to mothers on PTU may develop a goiter and be clinically hypothyroid.

options.label: C
options.text: Propylthiouracil does not cross the placenta.

options.label: D
options.text: Pregnant hyperthyroid women, even when appropriately treated, have an increased risk of developing preeclampsia.

questions.correct_answer: B. Infants born to mothers on PTU may develop a goiter and be clinically hypothyroid.

questions.text: A 20-year-old G1 patient delivers a live-born infant with cutaneous lesions, limb defects, cerebral cortical atrophy, and chorioretinitis. Her pregnancy was complicated by pneumonia at 18 weeks. What is the most likely causative agent?

options.label: A
options.text: Cytomegalovirus

options.label: B
options.text: Rubella virus

options.label: C
options.text: Treponemal pallidum

options.label: D
options.text: Varicella zoster

questions.text: A 20-year-old woman who works as a kindergarten teacher presents for her routine visit at 32 weeks. Her fundal height measures 40 cm. An ultrasound reveals polyhydramnios, an appropriately grown fetus with ascites and scalp edema. The patient denies any recent illnesses, but some of the children at her school have been sick recently. What is the most likely cause of the fetal findings?

options.label: A
options.text: Cytomegalovirus

options.label: B
options.text: Hepatitis B

options.label: C
options.text: Influenza A

options.label: D
options.text: Parvovirus
